action.action-desc: Mr. Stanton introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act to include certain communities, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Downwinders Parity Act of 2023.

section.header: Inclusion under the radiation exposure compensation act
section.text: Section 4(b)(1) of the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act (42 U.S.C. 2210 note; Public Law 101–426) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking that portion of; and
by striking that consists of townships 13 through 16 at ranges 63 through 71; and

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by inserting all acreage in any county all or part of which is located in before that part.

section.text: Within 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Attorney General shall submit to the relevant committees of the House of Representatives and of the Senate a report that outlines efforts to educate and conduct outreach to persons made newly eligible for benefits under the amendments made by section 2 of this Act.
